text: Vigilance
flavor: Kongming's predecessor helped Liu Bei win the battle of Fancheng by recognizing and defeating Cao Ren's use of the dreaded "Eight Gold Locks" formation.
originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Alert Shu Infantry to tap.
name: Alert Shu Infantry
Ambition's Cost
text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
originalText: Draw three cards. You lose 3 life.
flavor:
"When you give offense to heaven, to whom can you pray?"
—Cao Cao, quoting Confucius

name: Balance of Power

rulings.text: The number of cards is counted during resolution.

text: If target opponent has more cards in hand than you, draw cards equal to the difference.
originalText: If you have fewer cards in your hand than your opponent does, you draw until you have the same number. (When you play Balance of Power it doesn't count as in your hand.)

text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor:
"Barbarian tribes with their rulers are inferior to Chinese states without them."
—Confucius, The Analects (trans. Lau)
originalText: Horsemanship
name: Barbarian General

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

name: Barbarian Horde
flavor: Only twenty years after the Sima clan united the empire, invading barbarians divided it again.

name: Blaze
text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.
flavor:
"Spreading flames illumined cloud and sea:
Cao Cao went down; 'twas Zhou Yu's victory."

name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
originalText: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.
flavor: Kongming and Lu Su tricked Wei troops into shooting over 100,000 arrows at them to later use against the Wei at Red Cliffs.

name: Borrowing the East Wind
text: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each creature with horsemanship and each player.
originalText: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each player and each creature with horsemanship. (This includes you and your creatures with horsemanship.)

name: Brilliant Plan
text: Draw three cards.
originalText: Draw three cards.
flavor: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating the Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

name: Broken Dam
text: Tap one or two target creatures without horsemanship.
originalText: Tap any one or two creatures without horsemanship. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
flavor: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

name: Burning Fields
text: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to target opponent.
originalText: Burning Fields deals 5 damage to your opponent.
flavor:
"In raiding and plundering, be like fire, in immovability like a mountain."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

name: Burning of Xinye

rulings.text: Burning of Xinye targets only an opponent. If that player is an illegal target by the time Burning of Xinye resolves, the entire spell is countered.
The lands that will be destroyed aren't chosen until Burning of Xinye resolves.

A land with a regeneration shield on it will regenerate from Burning of Xinye's destruction effect. However, the spell or ability that creates that shield must be cast or activated before Burning of Xinye starts to resolve.

In a multiplayer game, only lands controlled by two players (you and the targeted opponent) are destroyed. However, Burning of Xinye will deal 4 damage to each creature, even those controlled by other players.

As Burning of Xinye resolves, first you destroy four lands you control (all at the same time), then the targeted opponent destroys four lands he or she controls (all at the same time). That player chooses which of his or her lands to destroy. Neither of you can choose to destroy a land with indestructible.

text: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands he or she controls. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.
originalText: You destroy four of your lands and your opponent destroys four of his or her lands. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)

text: {T}: Target opponent discards two cards. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Cao Cao to force your opponent to choose and discard two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)
name: Cao Cao, Lord of Wei

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
When Cao Ren, Wei Commander enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
flavor: Cao Cao's cousin, Cao Ren was known throughout the three kingdoms as the fiercest of warriors.
originalText:
Horsemanship
When Cao Ren comes into play, you lose 3 life.
name: Cao Ren, Wei Commander

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

name: Capture of Jingzhou
text: Take an extra turn after this one.
originalText: You take another turn after this one.
flavor: The province of Jingzhou was the fulcrum of the three kingdoms. At separate times it was coveted and controlled by the Wu, the Shu, and the Wei.

name: Champion's Victory
text:
Cast Champion's Victory only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.
originalText:
Play Champion's Victory only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Return any one attacking creature to its owner's hand.

name: Coercion
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
originalText: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Your opponent discards that card.
flavor: Though he held the title of prime minister, Cao Cao used the emperor's name to exert his own influence on the empire.

name: Control of the Court
text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
originalText: Draw four cards and put them into your hand. Then discard three cards at random from your hand.
flavor: "Power-hungry eunuchs, the curse of the dynasty, have thrown the masses of the people into the depths of misery."

name: Corrupt Court Official
text: When Corrupt Court Official enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
originalText: When Corrupt Official comes into play, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

text: When Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
originalText: When Corrupt Eunuchs comes into play, it deals 2 damage to any one creature. (If you're the only one with creatures, deal the damage to one of them.)
name: Corrupt Eunuchs

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Corrupt Eunuchs enters the battlefield, it will have to target itself.

text: When Council of Advisors enters the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: Sun Quan's long and successful rule in the years 199 to 251 was due to his ability to choose and foster talented advisors and generals.
originalText: When Council of Advisors comes into play, draw a card.
name: Council of Advisors
Counterintelligence
text: Return one or two target creatures to their owners' hands.
originalText: Return any one or two creatures to their owner's hand.
flavor: Before the battle of Red Cliffs, a supposedly sleeping Zhou Yu allowed his old friend, a Wei advisor, to steal a planted letter forged as if from Wei's two best admirals.

text: {T}: Target opponent discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Cunning Advisor to force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.
name: Cunning Advisor

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

name: Deception
text: Target opponent discards two cards.
originalText: Your opponent chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand. (If your opponent has only one card, he or she discards it.)
flavor: Believing they wrote the forged letter that had been stolen from Zhou Yu, Cao Cao rashly executed his two best admirals for treason.

name: Desert Sandstorm
text: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature.
originalText: Desert Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)
flavor: While pursuing the remnants of Yuan Shao's forces into the Wuhan Desert, Cao Cao was temporarily turned back by a fierce sandstorm.

name: Desperate Charge

rulings.text: Desperate Charge affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. A creature that enters the battlefield later in the turn won't get +2/+0.

text: Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: All your creatures get +2/+0 until the end of the turn.
flavor: "Lieutenants dishonored, corpses carted home; The general raises troops again to take revenge."

text: {T}: Destroy target creature of your choice, then destroy target creature of an opponent's choice. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Diaochan to destroy any one creature. Then, your opponent destroys any one creature of his or her choice.
name: Diaochan, Artful Beauty

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: When Dong Zhou, the Tyrant enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to that player.
originalText: When Dong Zhou comes into play, choose one of your opponent's creatures. That creature deals damage to him or her equal to its power. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any creatures in play.)
name: Dong Zhou, the Tyrant
Eightfold Maze

rulings.text: If all the attacking creatures attack your planeswalkers, you can't cast Eightfold Maze. To cast it, a creature needs to have attacked _you_.
If you're able to cast Eightfold Maze, it can target any attacking creature (including one attacking a planeswalker).

text:
Cast Eightfold Maze only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target attacking creature.
originalText:
Play Eightfold Maze only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Destroy any one attacking creature.

name: Empty City Ruse
text: Target opponent skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
originalText: Your opponent can't attack on his or her next turn.
flavor: Out of time and options, Kongming was forced to bluff at Xicheng. He tricked an army of 150,000 Wei by leaving the city gates open and calmly playing the zither.

name: Eunuchs' Intrigues
text: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Other creatures he or she controls can't block this turn.
originalText: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Only that creature can block this turn.
flavor: Taking control of powerful court positions one by one, eunuchs eventually brought on the fall of the Han dynasty, leading to the chaos of the Three Kingdoms.

name: Exhaustion

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
originalText: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping creatures and lands.
flavor: Starving and worn, Cao Cao escaped from the battle of Red Cliffs with only 27 of his original 800,000 men.

name: Extinguish
text: Counter target sorcery spell.
originalText:
Play Extinguish only in response to another player playing a sorcery.
That sorcery has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

name: False Defeat
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
originalText: Take any one creature card from your graveyard and put that creature into play.
flavor:
"All warfare is based on deception."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)

name: False Mourning
text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
originalText: Take any one card from your graveyard and put that card on the top of your library.
flavor: Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other famous generals feigned their deaths in order to later surprise their opponents.

name: Famine
text: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)
flavor: "But it was a year of dearth. People were reduced to eating leaves of jujube trees. Corpses were seen everywhere in the countryside."

name: Fire Ambush
text: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Fire Ambush deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.
flavor: "With fire he broke the battle at Bowang . . . . Striking fear deep into Cao Cao's soul, thus Kongming scored a coup at his debut."

text: Sacrifice Fire Bowman: Fire Bowman deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may destroy Fire Bowman to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.
name: Fire Bowman

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: Whenever Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor: Following the battle of Redcliffs, both Liu Bei and Sun Quan coveted the province of Jingzhou. After Sun Quan's troops failed to capture it, Liu Bei's succeeded.
originalText: When Flanking Troops attacks, you may tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
name: Flanking Troops
Forced Retreat
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
originalText: Return any one creature from play to the top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"Leadership, not numbers, determines victory."
—A Wu commander, before his 5,000 troops forced 15,000 Wei troops to retreat from Ruxu

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: G

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: G

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Forest
originalText: G

name: Forest Bear
flavor:
Fish and bear paws—one can't have both.
—Chinese idiom meaning
"you can't have it both ways"

name: Ghostly Visit
text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
originalText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black.
flavor: Cao Cao was haunted to death by the ghosts of the empresses and other high courtiers he had murdered.

name: Guan Yu's 1,000-Li March
text: Destroy all tapped creatures.
originalText: Destroy all tapped creatures. (This includes your tapped creatures.)
flavor: "He Guan Yu covered the ground on a thousand-li horse; / With dragon blade he took each pass by force."

text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
When Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.
originalText:
Horsemanship
When Guan Yu is put into your graveyard from play, you may shuffle Guan Yu into your library.
name: Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
If Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into your library.
If a replacement effect has Guan Yu move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

name: Heavy Fog

rulings.text: If all the attacking creatures attack your planeswalkers, you can't cast Heavy Fog. To cast it, a creature needs to have attacked _you_.
Heavy Fog prevents only damage that would be dealt to you by attacking creatures. It won't prevent damage attacking creatures would deal to creatures or planeswalkers you control.

Heavy Fog prevents all damage attacking creatures would deal to you this turn, not just combat damage. Noncombat damage from those creatures is prevented only if they're still attacking at the time that damage would be dealt or, if the creature has left the battlefield by then, if it was an attacking creature at the time it left.

text:
Cast Heavy Fog only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.
originalText:
Play Heavy Fog only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
This turn, all damage dealt to you by attacking creatures is reduced to 0.

text: {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Hua Tuo to put any one creature card from your graveyard on the top of your library.
name: Hua Tuo, Honored Physician

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: Huang Zhong, Shu General can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor:
"Virile in war, he kept the north in fear;
His prodigies subdued the western sphere."
originalText: Huang Zhong can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn.
name: Huang Zhong, Shu General

text: Whenever Hunting Cheetah deals damage to an opponent, you may search your library for a Forest card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
originalText: When Hunting Cheetah successfully damages your opponent, you may search your library for a forest card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.
name: Hunting Cheetah

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Hunting Cheetah's ability allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Forest, not just a card with the name Forest.

name: Imperial Edict
text: Target opponent chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy it.
originalText: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Destroy that creature.
flavor: Frustrated with Cao Cao's control of the imperial court, Emporer Xian secretly issued an edict condemning him, using his own blood as ink.

text: When Imperial Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for a creature card with power 2 or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: When Imperial Recruiter comes into play, search your library for a creature card with power no greater than 2, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your library afterward.
name: Imperial Recruiter

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
If a creature card has "*" in its power, the ability that defines its power works in all zones.

name: Imperial Seal
text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
originalText: Search your library for any one card. Shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
flavor: "If Heaven has placed it in your hands, it means that the throne is destined to be yours."

name: Independent Troops
flavor: "The empire, long united, must divide, and long divided, must unite."

Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

originalText: U

originalText: U

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Island
originalText: U

name: Kongming's Contraptions
text: {T}: Kongming's Contraptions deals 2 damage to target attacking creature. Activate this ability only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
originalText: After you're attacked, before you declare blockers, you may tap Kongming's Contraptions to have it deal 2 damage to any one attacking creature.

text: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor:
"Such a lord as this—all virtues' height—
Had never been, nor ever was again."
originalText: All your other creatures get +1/+1 as long as Kongming is in play.
name: Kongming, "Sleeping Dragon"

text: {T}: Return Lady Sun and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: Sister to Sun Quan and wife to Liu Bei, Lady Sun often felt her loyalty to both tested.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Lady Sun to return it and any one other creature to their owners' hands.
name: Lady Sun

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor:
"A man, and such a fool! I, a woman, will fight them for you."
—Lady Zhurong to her husband Meng Huo, before leading an army against the Shu
originalText: Horsemanship
name: Lady Zhurong, Warrior Queen

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Liu Bei, Lord of Shu gets +2/+2 as long as you control a permanent named Guan Yu, Sainted Warrior or a permanent named Zhang Fei, Fierce Warrior.
flavor:
"Only wisdom and virtue can truly win men's devotion."
—Liu Bei
originalText:
Horsemanship
As long as you have Guan Yu and/or Zhang Fei in play, Liu Bei gets +2/+2.
name: Liu Bei, Lord of Shu

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
originalText: When Lone Wolf attacks and is blocked, you may have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.
name: Lone Wolf

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

text: Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack you may put Loyal Retainers in your graveyard to take any one Legend card from your graveyard and put that creature into play.
name: Loyal Retainers

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: Haste; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."
originalText:
Horsemanship
Lu Bu is unaffected by summoning sickness.
name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.
originalText: Horsemanship
name: Lu Meng, Wu General

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Lu Su to draw a card.
name: Lu Su, Wu Advisor

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.
originalText:
Horsemanship
When Lu Xun successfully damages your opponent, you may draw a card.
name: Lu Xun, Scholar General

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.
Lu Xun's second ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Ma Chao, Western Warrior attacks alone, it can't be blocked this combat.
originalText:
Horsemanship
Whenever Ma Chao attacks and no other creatures do, Ma Chao can't be blocked.
name: Ma Chao, Western Warrior

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

name: Marshaling the Troops
text: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way.
originalText: Tap any number of your creatures. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way. (Tapped creatures can't block.)

name: Meng Huo's Horde
flavor: Through his allies, Meng Huo commanded several hundred thousand troops composed of cavalry, rattan-armored warriors, infantry, naked men with swords, and wild animals.

text: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: The stubborn Meng Huo was captured and released by Kongming seven times before finally surrendering.
originalText: All your other green creatures get +1/+1 as long as Meng Huo is in play.
name: Meng Huo, Barbarian King
Misfortune's Gain

rulings.text: The creature's *owner* gains the life, regardless of who happens to control it.
A token's owner is the player under whose control it entered the battlefield.

text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
originalText: Destroy any one creature. That creature's owner gains 4 life.
flavor: The mourning families of commanders and generals were often given land, valuables, or money to compensate for their losses.

flavor: Penniless and far from home, many former Yellow Scarves and other soldiers became bandits to survive.
originalText: Mountain Bandit is unaffected by summoning sickness.

Mystic Denial
text: Counter target creature or sorcery spell.
originalText: Play Mystic Denial only in response to another player playing a creature or a sorcery. That card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

name: Overwhelming Forces
text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
originalText: Destroy all your opponent's creatures. you draw a card for each creature destroyed in this way.
flavor: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

text: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor:
". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme
That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Pang Tong to give any one creature +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

name: Peach Garden Oath
text: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
originalText: For each creature you have in play, you gain 2 life.
flavor:
"We three, though of separate ancestry, join in brotherhood . . . . We dare not hope to be together always but hereby vow to die the selfsame day."
—Peach Garden Oath

name: Poison Arrow
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
originalText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.
flavor: In ancient China, not wearing armor could be a fatal mistake. Guan Yu, Zhou Yu, Sun Ce, and other heros were struck by poison arrows.

name: Preemptive Strike
text: Counter target creature spell.
originalText:
Play Preemptive Strike only in response to another player playing a creature card.
That creature has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

name: Rally the Troops
text:
Cast Rally the Troops only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Untap all creatures you control.
originalText:
Play Rally the Troops only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Untap all your creatures.

name: Ravages of War
text: Destroy all lands.
originalText: Destroy all lands. (This includes your lands.)
flavor: "Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war." —Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching (trans. Feng and English)

text: When Ravaging Horde enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
flavor: Upon his return to the capitol after taking soldiers to loot a nearby peaceful town, the prime minister, Dong Zhou, boasted of it as a victory over bandits.
originalText: When Ravaging Horde comes into play, destroy any one land.
name: Ravaging Horde

text: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than 7,000 warships on the Yangtze.
originalText: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.
name: Red Cliffs Armada
Relentless Assault

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. You may declare an additional attack this turn.
flavor: With only 70,000 men under his command at the battle of Guandu, Cao Cao was able to defeat Yuan Shao and his 700,000.

text: Haste
flavor: "Across the land rebellions seethed and swarmed / As vicious war lords swooped down on all sides."
originalText: Renegade Troops is unaffected by summoning sickness.
name: Renegade Troops
Return to Battle
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return any one creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "Swallowing his eye, the valiant Xiahou Dun fought on; / But Cao Cao's vanguard, its commander wounded, could not hold out for long."

name: Riding Red Hare
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
originalText: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains horsemanship until the end of the turn.
flavor: One of the greatest steeds in the empire, Red Hare could travel a thousand li a day and climb hills as if running on flat ground.

name: Riding the Dilu Horse

rulings.text: The spell's effect has no duration. The targeted creature gets +2/+2 until the game ends or it leaves the battlefield. It has horsemanship until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect causes it to lose horsemanship.

text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship. This effect lasts indefinitely.)
originalText: Any one creature gets +2/+2 and gains horsemanship.
flavor:
"All men have their appointed time; that's something no horse can change."
—Liu Bei, after being told that the
Dilu brings its master ill fortune

name: Rockslide Ambush
text: Rockslide Ambush deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
originalText: Rockslide Ambush deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountain cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountain cards.)

name: Rolling Earthquake
text: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without horsemanship and each player.
originalText: Rolling Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without horsemanship. (This includes you and your creatures without horsemanship.)

name: Sage's Knowledge
text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return any one sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know."
—Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching
(trans. Feng and English)

text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: In establishing the Shu kingdom, Liu Bei's forces fought against Ma Chao at Chengdu. Eventually, Ma Chao surrendered and became one of Liu Bei's Tiger Generals.
originalText: Horsemanship
name: Shu Cavalry

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

text: Whenever Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: Confronting Cao Cao's army at Steepslope Bridge, Zhang Fei bellowed, "I am Zhang Fei of Yan! Who dares fight me to the death?" Cao Cao's army cowered and fled.
originalText: When Shu Defender blocks, it gets +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
name: Shu Defender

text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
flavor: Throughout the three kingdoms, important generals were often guarded by small groups of expert soldiers known as "elite companions."
originalText: Horsemanship
name: Shu Elite Companions

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

name: Shu Elite Infantry
flavor: Kongming's first campaign against the Wei kingdom was a rousing success until an arrogant Shu general, Ma Su, foolishly lost the city of Jieting.

text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor:
"The common folk are ceaselessly active. The fields are fertile and the soil productive, and neither flood nor drought plagues us."
—A Shu diplomat
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Shu Farmer to gain 1 life.
name: Shu Farmer

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

name: Shu Foot Soldiers
flavor: Liu Bei lost many men at the battle of Runan because of his lack of strategy. It wasn't until he met Kongming that he began to truly succeed as a leader.

text: Vigilance; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
originalText:
Horsemanship
Attacking doesn't cause Shu General to tap.
name: Shu General

rulings.text: Despite the similarities between horsemanship and flying, horsemanship doesn't interact with flying or reach.

text: When Shu Grain Caravan enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Keeping a million-man army fed was no easy task. Grain and rice caravans were the lifeblood of the empire.
originalText: When Shu Grain Caravan comes into play, you gain 2 life.
name: Shu Grain Caravan

text: When Shu Soldier-Farmers enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: During Kongming's campaigns against the Wei, his Shu troops rotated from the battlefront to the fields every hundred days.
originalText: When Shu Soldier-Farmers comes into play, you gain 4 life.
name: Shu Soldier-Farmers

text: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor: Sima Yi fought for four generations of the Cao family before his own grandson became emperor and united the three kingdoms.
originalText: Sima Yi has power equal to the number of swamp cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped swamp cards.)
name: Sima Yi, Wei Field Marshal

text: Whenever Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Unless you enter the tiger's lair, you cannot get hold of the tiger's cubs."
—Sun Tzu, Art of War (trans. Giles)
originalText: When Slashing Tiger attacks and is blocked, it gets +2/+2 until the end of the turn.
name: Slashing Tiger

rulings.text: When Slashing Tiger becomes blocked, the ability will trigger just once no matter how many creatures are blocking it.

name: Southern Elephant
flavor: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

name: Spoils of Victory

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Spoils of Victory allows you to search your library for any card with the land type Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest, not just a card with one of those names.

text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterward.

name: Spring of Eternal Peace
text: You gain 8 life.
originalText: You gain 8 life.
flavor: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: Throughout Chinese history, generals have often been referred to as tigers for their fierceness, strength, and bravery.
originalText: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature each turn.
name: Stalking Tiger
Stolen Grain

rulings.text: If the targeted opponent is an illegal target by the time Stolen Grain resolves, the ability is countered. You won't gain life.

text: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to target opponent. You gain 5 life.
originalText: Stolen Grain deals 5 damage to your opponent. You gain 5 life.

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.
originalText: Destroy any one land.
flavor: Soldiers often blocked off the steep mountain passes to ambush enemy troops in western and central China.

name: Strategic Planning

rulings.text: If there are fewer than three cards in your library, you look at all of them, put one of them into your hand, and put the rest into your graveyard.

text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
originalText: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: "Plans evolved within the tent decide a victory 1,000 li away."

name: Straw Soldiers
flavor: The overnight appearance of miles of "armed" Wu forts at Guangling frightened a much vaster Wei force into fleeing for their lives.

name: Trip Wire
text: Destroy target creature with horsemanship.

flavor: Trip wire, hooked poles, and sunken pits were commonly used to unhorse riders during the Three Kingdoms period.

text: Destroy target tapped creature.

"Until I've gnawed their flesh and exterminated their clans, my humiliation will not be effaced."

text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
originalText: All your creatures get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.

name: Volunteer Militia
flavor: After making the Peach Garden Oath, the three brothers raised an army of 500 youths to fight the Yellow Scarves rebellion.

name: Warrior's Oath

originalText: Take another turn after this one. At the end of that turn, you lose the game. (You don't lose if you've already won.)

"If I fail, my head is yours."
—Warrior's oath common
during the Three Kingdoms period

originalText: Any one creature gets +4/+4 until the end of the turn.

text: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
originalText: When Wolf Pack attacks and is blocked, you may have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.
name: Wolf Pack

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

text: Wu Admiral gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.
flavor: The Wu kingdom's well-trained admirals were integral to the Southlands' victory at Red Cliffs as well as the kingdom's defense.
originalText: As long as your opponent has an island in play, Wu Admiral gets +1/+1.

rulings.text: If Zodiac Dragon is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, you can't return it to your hand. Similarly, if a replacement effect has Zodiac Dragon move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.
Even though Zodiac Dragon is a Dragon, it doesn't have flying.

text: Mountainwalk
flavor: ". . . Near death in Baidi, having reigned three years, / Bei sadly placed his son in Kongming's care. . . ."
originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player has a mountain in play, Zodiac Goat can't be blocked.)
name: Zodiac Goat

text: Islandwalk
flavor: ". . . ‘First take Jingzhou, next the Riverlands; / On that rich region, base your own royal stand.' . . ."
originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player has an island in play, Zodiac Horse can't be blocked.)
name: Zodiac Horse

text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor:
". . . By six offensives from the hills of Qi
Kongming sought to change Han's destiny. . . ."
originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodaic Monkey can't be blocked.)

text: Swampwalk
flavor: ". . . Cao's abdication changed the face of all; / No mighty battles marked the Southland's fall. . . ."

text: Swampwalk
flavor: ". . . Zhong Hui and Deng Ai next led armies west: / And to the Cao, Han's hills and streams now passed. . . ."
originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Pig can't be blocked.)
name: Zodiac Pig

text: Forestwalk
flavor: ". . . The world's affairs rush on, an endless stream; / A sky-told fate, infinite in reach, dooms all. . . ."
originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player has a forest in play, Zodiac Hare can't be blocked.)
name: Zodiac Rabbit

text: Swampwalk
flavor: " . . . Cao Pi, Cao Rui, Fang, Mao, and briefly, Huan— / The Sima took the empire in their turn. . . ."
originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has a swamp in play, Zodiac Rat can't be blocked.)

text: Plainswalk
flavor: ". . . But the time of Han had run—could he Kongming not tell?— / That night his master star fell past the hills. . . ."
originalText: Plainswalk (If defending player has a plain in play, Zodiac Rooster can't be blocked.)

text: Swampwalk
flavor: "Thrice Xuande's ardent quest led to Nanyang, / Where Sleeping Dragon unveiled Han's partition: . . ."

Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Zuo Ci, the Mocking Sage can't be blocked by creatures with horsemanship.
originalText:
